headline.main: CALIFORNIA.; Political Aspects--Gen. Shields on Mexico-- Earthquake and Lightning--Diggers Saved by Habeas Corpus--Benjamin, theWandering Jew--No Oregon Senator--Night among the Medicine Men.

docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Monday, Oct. 1, 1860. As we near election, all parties grow more mod erate, and excitement dies out. No movement has been made within the week that alters the relative position of the contending forces. The big bell paraded through the street one night, and the whole Union Party went over to Oakland in a ferryboat discharging rockets, without regard to expense, as they sailed.

headline.main: BOARD OF ALDERMEN.; THE PRIVILEGE OF REOPENING THE VAULTS OF ST. STEPHEN'S (R.C.) CHURCH GRANTED.

docs.lead_paragraph: Among the first papers adopted was a resolution allowing the pastor of St. Stephen's Catholic Church in Twenty-eighth-street, to deposit the bodies of parties, whose friends might desire to have them placed there, in the receiving vault of that Church. docs.snippet: The United States Mail steamer Quaker City, R.W. SCHUFELDT, Commander, from Havana on Monday, 15th inst., arrived at this port yesterday morning.
